artist: Artist: Claes Janz. Visscher II; Artist: after Maarten de Vos
creditline: Gift of James A. Bergquist, Boston, in honor of Rachel McGarry
description: woman wearing a crown lying in a very elaborate canopy bed at center surrounded by male figures; text at bottom
inscription:
in plate, at bottom: M. de Vos invent.  /  Cantica.3.1.  /  ICVisscher Excud.
In plate, lower right: 3
text: A crowned woman, an allegory of the the Catholic Church (or perhaps simply Faith) lies in a bed with four posts labled Justitia (Justice), Fortitu (Fortitude), Provinden (Providence), and Prudentia (Prudence). Above her head, God float s on a cloud. At the foot of the bed is a scene of The Judgment of Solomon, in which the wise king identifies the true mother of an infant. The room is crowded with visitors: Solomon in military dress, scholars, priests, and others. At the upper left a small scene in the distance appearsto show soldiers attacking the crowned woman.
title: Plate 3, from "The Song of Solomon"
